Articles.Content: As you can see my issues, both nodes are put on the bottom, but I'm not sure why. Any help on this? If needed I can upload my model and the CFG.

For starters you want your axis to Y-up. But for your cfg, I always place my node's manually by editing the cfg and constantly rebooting the program (primitive, but works great after words).

What's happening now is that the top node is basically 0,0,0 as seen in your definition. Each 0,0,0 of the first 3 zeros means x,y,z. Try setting the 0 to something higher and 0. Maybe 5. And work your way up or down by editing the cfg file.
